com.adeptions.clarguments.definitions

Interface ArgumentDefinition<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - is the final type of the argument value
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractArgumentDefinition, BooleanArgumentDefinition, DoubleArgumentDefinition, FileArgumentDefinition, FlagArgumentDefinition, InformationalArgumentDefinition, IntegerArgumentDefinition, StringArgumentDefinition

    public interface ArgumentDefinition<T>
    Interface for argument definitions

      • convertRawValue

        T convertRawValue(int tokenPosition,
                  java.lang.String rawValue,
                  Argument<T> argument,
                  ArgName specifiedArgName)
           throws BadArgException
        Converts the raw incoming arg value (string) to the appropriate type
        Parameters:
        tokenPosition - the position of the arg in srgs[]
        rawValue - the raw incoming arg value
        argument - the argument
        specifiedArgName - the specified arg name
        Returns:
        the converted value
        Throws:
        BadArgException - if the conversion fails (i.e. the raw value is not a valid representation of expected type)

      • validateValue

        T validateValue(int tokenPosition,
                T value,
                Argument<T> argument,
                ArgName specifiedArgName)
         throws BadArgException
        Validates the converted arg value
        Parameters:
        tokenPosition - the position of the arg in srgs[]
        value - the value to be checked
        argument - the argument
        specifiedArgName - the specified arg name
        Returns:
        the validated value
        Throws:
        BadArgException - if the validation fails (e.g. the value was out of range)
